location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: PZ 1726/31 'Persian Gulf: Policy and administrative problems in Arab Sheikhdoms'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence for this description (used for referencing) commences at f 54, and terminates at f 65, as it is part of a larger physical volume; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence regarding the level of direct influence held by the British Government and the Government of India over the administration of Muscat and other Persian Gulf states, and proposals for a reduction in this influence in favour of local rulers. The primary correspondents are the India Office and the Government of India.
